description: {"blocks":[{"key":"43v6v","text":"We describe a method that allows the staining of intact lysosomes using lysotracker for flow cytometry analysis. The analysis can provide a quantitative indication of the level of enrichment of the organelle immunoprecipitation (% of lysososomal+ beads) and can be used as a quality control check for the purity of the immunoprecipitated lysoIPs. Since only a small fraction of the immunoprecipitated material is needed for flow cytometry, this technique can be coupled with other assays, like western blotting or proteomics. While this protocol is focused on the staining and detection of lysosomes, it can be easily modified to analyse different organelles by changing the staining procedure and adjusting the parameters of the cytometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lnqo","text":"\n\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6vbcc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46vt8","text":"PBMCs (or other cells)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59cus","text":"Bafilomycin A1 (Enzo LifeScience, BML-CM110-0100)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h4d2","text":"Deep Red Lysotracker (Thermo, L12492)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t2l7","text":"DMSO","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7v55p","text":"anti-TMEM192 magnetic beads","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eb43k","text":"BSA magnetic beads","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmf0c","text":"KPBS","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7068t","text":"Flow cytometry tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32s6h","text":"Flow cytometer with APC lasers and filters","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arrut","text":"Water bath","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pk2c","text":"The following protocol allows the detection and analysis of the lysosomes isolated  by immunoprecipitation with anti-TMEM192 magnetic beads from peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs). Cells were incubated with or without the lysotracker prior to the lysosomal immunoprecipitation. Additionally, PBMCs were treated with the V-ATPase inhibitor Bafilomycin A1, that blocks the acidification of the lysosomes and drastically reduces the signal. We included this step as a further proof of the functionality of the isolated lysosomes, but it can be avoided if unnecessary.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2kps","text":"This protocol can be adapted to any other cell type.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9801p","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87tl0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6c5ib","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"etr5d","text":"We noticed that TMEM192 beads have a strong autofluorescence signal, particularly in the FITC and mCherry channels. Using a higher excitation wavelength solved this issue. Specifically, we used the Deep Red Lysotracker (max ex 647, max em 668) and used the APC channel for flow cytometry analysis.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"el1ub","text":"Perform endogenous organelle IP as in dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.x54v9yp51g3e/v1 (steps 12-33)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":48}],"data":{}},{"key":"eaeai","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2t7lb","text":"At the end of the IPs, for each of the initial tubes, there should be 2 samples, a TMEM192 IP and a control IP (BSA-beads).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk54f","text":"Add   of KPBS to each FACS tube and label them accordingly","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"di4pn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"1B255B590EA911EF9F1A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdx.doi.org%2F10.17504%2Fprotocols.io.x54v9yp51g3e%2Fv1\u0026data=05%7C02%7CEBagnoli001%40dundee.ac.uk%7Ca567db1139964e44667808dc7033304b%7Cae323139093a4d2a81a65d334bcd9019%7C0%7C0%7C638508612346786507%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C\u0026sdata=wjzPZMKoC%2F%2FbEPD9BM6zmyrQtRbbOsTuYukkpz8Xi5k%3D\u0026reserved=0"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6n7ld","text":"The IP is normally performed using 50 μl of beads/sample. However, only a small fraction of the beads is analysed (approx 1/200 of initial beads), the rest of the IP can be used for WB or other techniques. The initial amount of beads can also be scaled down.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

LysoTracker™ Deep Red has the excitation at 647nm and emission at 668nm (APC channel)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ee8aj","text":"Dilute the samples. We used a dilution of 1/10, by adding   of stained beads to   of KPBS into FACS tube.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"93nnu","text":"Run the samples on a flow cytometer.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmiil","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dlt2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"asm4v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctkev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqme7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag319","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"40","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5v1bv","text":"On a BD LSR Fortessa we used the following voltages:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"acna9","text":"FSC: 600","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6g7jh","text":"SSC: 240","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"34fh4","text":"APC: 700","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1s3i5","text":"FlowJo analysis of FCS files","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1si4f","text":"Isolate the beads from the debris by gating on the SSC vs FSC plot.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7or9k","text":"Isolate positive beads either on the APC histograms or on the APC vs FSC plot","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40ig","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ceust","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8pkgp","text":"Use the appropriate control to gate for the positive beads (TMEM192 pulldown without tracker)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
